intro: Boopis gracilis, commonly known as the slender boopis, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its delicate, fern-like foliage. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. Boopis gracilis thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland areas. It is a relatively rare species, making it of interest to botanists and conservationists.
